item.title: [8.2.3430] |ModeChanged| event
item.description: Triggered when the mode changes.

item.title: [8.2.3424] Add multispace to 'listchars'
item.description: Show two or more spaces no matter where they appear.

item.title: [8.2.3184, 8.2.3226] Add digraph_get(), digraph_getlist(), digraph_set(), digraph_setlist()
item.description: List and define digraphs from functions.

item.title: [8.2.3160, 8.2.3198] Add list to 'breakindentopt'
item.description: Add additional indent for lines that match a numbered or bulleted list (using the 'formatlistpat' setting).

item.title: [8.2.3110] Add \%.l, \%<.l, and \%>.l patterns
item.description: Match the line the cursor is currently on; see |/\%l|.

item.title: [8.2.3022] Add 'cryptmethod'=xchaha20
item.description: More secure encryption from libsodium.

item.title: [8.2.2914, 8.2.2971] Add |zp|, |zP|, |zy|
item.description: |zp| pastes in block mode without adding trailing whitespace, |zy| yanks without trailing whitespace.

item.title: [8.2.2854] Add %{ to 'statusline'
item.description: %{expr} reëvaluates the expression as a 'statusline' formatting string.

item.title: [8.2.2813] Add f flag in :vimgrep
item.description: "Fuzzy" match :vimgrep results.

item.title: [8.2.2675] Add 'autoshelldir'
item.description: Automatically change directory in Vim from terminal window.

item.title: [8.2.2606] Add strcharlen()
item.description: Get length of string counting combining characters separately.

item.title: [8.2.2658] Loop over a string
item.description: Loop over a string as `for char in "str"`; loops are by codepoint with any combining characters.

item.title: [8.2.2508, 8.2.2518, 8.2.2518, 8.2.2542, 8.2.2569] Expand 'fillchars'
item.description:
New values: "eob" to change change the (~) to indicate non-existing lines, "foldopen", "foldclose", and "foldsep" to change 'foldcolumn' markers.
'fillchars' can be set per-window (previously it was always global).
Also allow multibyte characters in 'fillchars' and 'statusline'.

item.title: [8.2.2490] Add followwrap to 'diffopt'
item.description: Don't reset 'wrap' for diff windows.

item.title: [8.2.2468] Add fullcommand()
item.description: Get the full command name from abbreviated ones (e.g. :s → :substitute)

item.title: [8.2.2454] lead: in 'listchars'
item.description: Highlight leading spaces when 'list' is set.

item.title: [8.2.2345, 8.2.2348, 8.2.2352, 8.2.2383, 8.2.2428] Detect focus events in terminal
item.description: The |FocusGained| and |FocusLost| autocmds can work inside a terminal. See |xterm-focus-event|.

item.title: [8.2.2366] :sleep!
item.description: Sleep and hide cursor.

item.title: [8.2.2324] Add charcol(), getcharpos(), setcharpos(), getcursorcharpos(), setcursorcharpos()
item.description: Multibyte-aware versions of col(), getpos(), setpos(), getcurpos(), cursor().

item.title: [8.2.2233] Add charidx()
item.description: Convert byte index to character index.

item.title: [8.2.2128] Add |VimSuspend| and |VimResume|
item.description: Triggered on suspend/resume; only for <C-z> and not SIGSTP/SIGCONT signals.

item.title: [8.2.1978] Add <Cmd>
[8.2.1933] :sort and sort() can do locale-aware sorting
item.description: :sort l or sort(..., 'l').

item.title: [8.2.1665, 8.2.1726, 8.2.1893, 8.2.1921] matchfuzzy(), matchfuzzypos()
item.description: "Fuzzy" matching.

item.title: [8.2.1874] Add |InsertLeavePre|
item.description: Triggered before leaving insert mode.

item.title: [8.2.1794] |??| operator
item.description: echo value ?? 'used if value is empty'

item.title: [8.2.1544] Add gettext()
item.description: Can be used to translate plugins.

item.title: [8.2.1535, 8.2.1536] Add setcellwidths(), charclass()
item.description: Allow overriding the display width for characters whose width is ambiguous.

item.title: [8.2.1401, 8.2.1413] Add g<Tab>; support :tabnext #, :tabclose #, etc.
item.description: g<Tab> goes back to the last accessed tab, and # in :tab* commands refer to the last accessed tab.

item.title: [8.2.1347] expand('<SID>')
item.description: Useful for the *func and *expr settings, e.g. let &includexpr = expand('<SID>') .. 'fun()' to use s:fun()

item.title: [8.2.0869, 8.2.0933, 8.2.0959, 8.2.1255] Add 'quickfixtextfunc'
item.description: Customize text contents of quickfix window; can also be passed as an argument to to setqflist()

item.title: [8.2.0988] Add sorting to readir(), readirex()
item.description: Add optional argument to readdir() and readdirex() to control sorting.

item.title: [8.2.0970] Add terminalprops()
item.description: List which features are supported in this terminal.

item.title: [8.2.0953] Add 'spelloptions'
item.description: Only accepted value is camel to spell check CamelCase words.

item.title: [8.2.0952] Add |SigUSR1| autocmd
item.description: Event to detect SIG_USR1.

item.title: [8.2.0935] Add flatten()
item.description: Flatten a list

item.title: [8.2.0924] Add getreginfo()
item.description: Returns detailed information for a register information; can be restored by passing to setreg().

item.title: [8.2.0877] Add searchcount()
item.description: Get details about current search.

item.title: [8.2.0863] Allow setting underline colour in terminal
item.description: Can use ctermul in :highlight to set the underline colour, or guisp if 'termguicolors' is enabled.

item.title: [8.2.0878] Add reduce()
item.description: Reduce list to single value.

item.title: [8.2.0875] Add readirex()
item.description: Like readdir(), but return a dict with attributes (i.e. stat() on Unix).

item.title: [8.2.0861] Add getmarklist()
item.description: Get list of marks, similar to :marks

item.title: [8.2.0860] Add unsigned to 'nrformats'
item.description: Ignore - before numbers and always treat them as unsigned for <C-a> and <C-x> so that using it on e.g. 1985-06-18 works as expected.

item.title: [8.2.0807, 8.2.0812, 8.2.0815] Add mapset()
item.description: Set mappings from a script, and can restore mappings.

item.title: [8.2.0775] Call Vim functions from Lua
item.description: Call Vim functions from Lua with vim.call('fun_name', 'arg') and vim.fn.fun_name('arg').

item.title: [8.2.0557, 8.2.0574] IPv6 support in channels
item.description: IPv6 support in channels

item.title: [8.2.0258] Add echoraw()
item.description: Output string to terminal with no processing; can be used to send escape codes.

item.title: [8.2.0095] Add optional error code to :cquit
item.description: Exit with a specific code, instead of always 1. |v:exiting| was added in 8.2.2070 (Nov 2020)

item.title: [8.1.2342, 8.1.2343] rand() and srand()
item.description: Generate random numbers.

item.title: [8.1.2341] interrupt()
item.description: Abort a running script.

item.title: [8.1.2326] strptime()
item.description: Parse a time string

item.title: [8.1.2251, 8.1.2255] :terminal ++shell
item.description: Run :terminal commands in the shell.

item.title: [8.1.2233] v:argv
item.description: Get commandline arguments Vim was invoked with.

item.title: [8.1.2231] Add |gM|
item.description: Move to middle of line.

item.title: [8.1.2229] |hl-LineNrAbove|, |hl-LineNrBelow|
item.description: Highlight line numbers above and below the cursor when 'relativenumber' is set.

item.title: [8.1.2019] Add 'cursorlineopt'
item.description: More control on how to display 'cursorline'.

item.title: [8.1.1902, 8.1.1904] border and align in 'completepopup'
item.description: More option to control completion popup menu.

item.title: [8.1.1880, 8.1.1882] popup in 'completeopt'
item.description: Show extra completion info in popup window (as an alternative to the preview window).

item.title: [8.1.1838] :spellrare
item.description: Mark words as rare in the spellfile.

item.title: [8.1.1803, 8.1.1809, 8.1.1834, 8.1.1835, 8.1.1996] -> operator
[8.1.1364, 8.1.1391, 8.1.1799, 8.1.1905, 8.1.1928] Popup windows
item.description: Popup windows are like the completion window, but can be controlled in VimScript to a much greater degree. See |popup|, 'previewpopup'. This is still an experimental feature.

item.title: [8.1.1769] 'completeslash'
item.description: Override 'shellslash' for completion.

item.title: [8.1.1683, 8.1.1692, 8.1.1705] #{} dict notation
item.description:
The #{} notation is the same as the regular {} dict notation, except that the key values don't need quoting:
#{foo: "bar"}.

item.title: [8.1.1502, 8.1.1565] Sound functions
item.description: Ability to play sound; see sound_playevent().

item.title: [8.1.1542] |v:option_command|, |v:option_oldlocal|, |v:option_oldglobal|
item.description: Improvements for the |OptionSet| event.

item.title: [8.1.1539] :const
item.description: Constants; same as :let v = 1 | :lockvar v

item.title: [8.1.1418] win_execute()
item.description: execute() in the context of a specific window.

item.title: [8.1.1391] 'wincolor'
item.description: Highlight group to use instead of |hl-Normal| for this window.

item.title: [8.1.1372] |g:actual_curwin|, |g:statusline_winid|
item.description: Temporarily set when running expressions inside the 'statusline' (%{expr}).

item.title: [8.1.1354] |:let=<<|
item.description:
Heredoc assignment:
let text =<< trim END
	text
END

item.title: [8.1.0579, 8.1.1340, 8.1.1341] Text properties
item.description: Assign metadata to text in a buffer, as an alternative to Vim's syntax highlighting. See |textprop|. This is still an experimental feature.

item.title: [8.1.1320, 8.1.1321, 8.1.1332] listener_add()
item.description: Add a callback that will be invoked when changed have been made to a buffer.

item.title: [8.1.1310] Default values for function arguments
item.description: e.g. function Fun(value=10). See |optional-function-argument|.

item.title: [8.1.1307] :xrestore
item.description: Reconnect to X server after restart.

item.title: [8.1.1305] environ(), getenv(), and setenv()
item.description: Deal with environment variables.

item.title: [8.1.1291] chdir()
item.description: Change directory with scope and ability to restore.

item.title: [8.1.1275] :cbefore, :cafter
item.description: Navigate to errors before/after the cursor.

item.title: [8.1.1270] Show match position when searching
item.description: Show "3/44" when using |n| and "S" is not in 'shortmess'.

item.title: [8.1.1256] :cabove, :cbelow, :labove, :lbelow
item.description: Navigate through errors relative to the cursor.

item.title: [8.1.1224] Control font weight on Windows'
item.description: Use "W" in 'guifont' to control font weight on Windows. See |gui-font|.

item.title: [8.1.1218] Tab-local directory
item.description: See :tcd. Similar to the window-local directory with :lcd.

item.title: [8.1.1188] v: prefix is required
item.description: Previously e.g. count would also work. The v: prefix is mandatory when :scriptversion is 3 or higher.

item.title: [8.1.1140] Add more arguments to winnr()
item.description: To find out what neighbors a window has.

item.title: [8.1.1138] |CompleteChanged| event
item.description: After each time the Insert mode completion menu changed.

item.title: [8.1.1122] str2list() and list2str()
item.description: Convert a string to a list of byte, or the reverse.

item.title: [8.1.1120] readdir()
item.description: Get contents of a directory.

item.title: [8.1.1116] :scriptversion
item.description: Specify VimScript compatibility level.

item.title: [8.1.1114] .. operator
item.description: String concatenation operator, as . is ambiguous. 'a' .. 'b' and 'a' . 'b' are identical. Also adds ..=.

item.title: [8.1.1113] ++once argument for :autocmd
item.description: Run an autocommand just once, e.g. au CursorMoved * ++once :echom 'ONCE'.

item.title: [8.1.1084] Add window ID argument to matchdelete(), clearmatches(), getmatches(), setmatches()
[8.1.1068] complete_info()
item.description: Get information about current completion.

item.title: [8.1.1056] rubyeval()
item.description: Evaluate a Ruby expression.

item.title: [8.1.0972] |CTRL-W_gt|, |CTRL-W_gT|
item.description: Switch tabs, like |gt| and |gT|. Mainly useful to switch from terminal window.
e.g. let var *= 2

item.title: [8.1.0888, 8.1.0897] a: variables are immutable
item.description: Previously it was possible to change a: variables in some cases.

item.title: [8.1.0759] Allow for a third character for "tab:" in 'listchars'
item.description: Third character is set as the last one for a tab, e.g. set listchars=tab:(_) shows a tab as (______).

item.title: [8.1.0735, 8.1.0756, 8.1.0757] Blob type
item.description: A blob stores binary data. Blob literals start with 0z, e.g. 0zDEADBEEF. See |blob|.

item.title: [8.1.0728] "p" flag in 'formatoptions'
item.description: Don't break lines at single spaces that follow periods.

item.title: [8.1.0706] :redrawtabline
item.description: Redraw tabline after changing 'tabline' (mainly useful for plugins).

item.title: [8.1.0614, 8.1.0658] sign_place(), sign_unplace(), etc
item.description: Functions for defining and placing signs.

item.title: [8.1.0515, 8.1.0573] Allow functions and commands to redefine themselves
item.description: Previously a ! always had to be added to function to overwrite a function with the same name. Now Vim is smarter and allows a function to overwrite itself. This means that using function! in your vimrc or plugin's autoload is almost never required any more.

item.title: [8.1.0487] :tlmenu
item.description: Popup menu for terminal.

item.title: [8.1.0360, 8.1.0393] Include the xdiff library
item.description: Include diff library instead of relying on external tools to improve diff quality. Many new 'diffopt' settings (e.g. set diffopt+=internal,algorithm:patience would be a good setting for many).

Comments in line continuations; see |line-continuation-comment|: 
au FileType git
            "\ Go to commit.
            \  nnoremap <Leader>g :exe printf(":!cd ~/src/vim && git diff %s^\!", split(getline("."), ' ')[1])<CR>
            "\ Delete commit.
            \| nnoremap <Leader>d :call search('^commit ', 'bc') \| :exe 'd' . (search('^commit ', 'n') - line("."))<CR>

item.title: [8.1.0311] |cfilter-plugin|
item.description: Filter quickfix/location list

item.title: [8.1.0105] 'vartabstop', 'varsofttabstop'
item.description: Variable tabstop widths, e.g. set vartabstop=4,8 makes the first tab 4 spaces, and the rest 8.

item.title: [8.1.0081, 8.1.0414] |OptionSet| autocmd
item.description: Triggered whenever an option is set.

item.title: [8.1.0027, 8.1.0035] prompt buffer
item.description: Mainly useful to feed user input to a job.

item.title: [8.0.1832] Allow :unlet $ENV
item.description: Previously there was no way to truly unset an environment variable (just set it to an empty string).

item.title: [8.0.1787] CTRL-R CTRL-L
item.description: Insert line from buffer in commandline

item.title: [8.0.1742] job_info() without argument lists all jobs
[8.0.1708] mkdir('p') won't fail fail if the directory already exists
[8.0.1641] Add the terminal API.
item.description: See |terminal-api|.

item.title: [8.0.1630] trim()
item.description: Clean whitespace; had to use substitute() before.

item.title: [8.0.1609, 8.0.1616] Add "!" to 'guioptions'
item.description: Use a Vim terminal window for :! shell commands.

item.title: [8.0.1558, 8.0.1570] Menus in terminal
item.description: Make :popup and right-click work in terminal.

item.title: [8.0.1531] 24 bit colors in Windows console
item.description: See 'termguicolors'.

item.title: [8.0.1491] 'pumwidth'
item.description: Minimum width of completion menu.

item.title: [8.0.1459] |DirChanged| event
item.description: When directory changed (with :cd, :lcd, etc.)

item.title: [8.0.1445] |CmdlineChanged| event
item.description: After a change was made to the text in the command line.

item.title: [8.0.1394] |TextYankPost| event
item.description: After yanking or deleting text.

item.title: [8.0.1364] win_screenpos().
item.description: Get winow position.

item.title: [8.0.1206] |CmdlineEnter|, |CmdlineLeave|
item.description: When entering and leaving the commandline.

item.title: [8.0.0693, 8.0.0730, 8.0.0744, 8.0.0804, 8.0.0929, 8.0.1108] :terminal
item.description: Terminal buffer.

item.title: [8.0.0716] |--clean|, 'viminfofile'
item.description: Start Vim with the default settings and without plugins.

item.title: [8.0.0431] E flag in 'cinoptions'
item.description: Set indent for extern block.

item.title: [8.0.0251] 'pyxversion', :pythonx
item.description: Make it easier to run Python code in both Python 2 and 3, depending on what is available.
